main_definition: offering a lower price or cost compared to something else.

meanings_and_examples.definition: lower in monetary value; less expensive than another thing
meanings_and_examples.example: The store sells apples cheaper today.

meanings_and_examples.definition: less costly to produce or obtain
meanings_and_examples.example: Using recycled materials can make the production process cheaper.

meanings_and_examples.definition: more affordable for consumers; often used in comparison with a higher-priced item
meanings_and_examples.example: The generic brand is cheaper than the name brand medication.

meanings_and_examples.definition: offering better value or a larger quantity at a lower price
meanings_and_examples.example: This supermarket has bulk buying deals that make it cheaper to buy in large quantities.
